parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Power Steering Hose and Clamp Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering hose and clamp can cause the loss of power steering, leading to difficulty controlling the vehicle, which can result in accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: Power steering fluid leakage
loss of power steering
difficulty turning the steering wheel
steering wheel pulling to one side
BAS/ESP light comes on
brakes engage
and the steering wheel turns to the right.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering pump can cause the loss of power steering, leading to difficulty controlling the vehicle, which can result in accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: Power steering fluid leakage
loss of power steering
difficulty turning the steering wheel
steering wheel pulling to one side
and repeated replacement of power steering pumps.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and unexpected activation of the brakes can cause the vehicle to stop abruptly, leading to accidents, loss of control, and potential fatalities.
symptoms: The vehicle stops suddenly without warning
the brake pedal goes to the floor
the BAS/ESP warning lights come on
the vehicle skids or pitches to one side
requiring the driver to counter-steer to maintain control.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Brake Line Failure due to Chafing
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake line can cause a loss of braking power, leading to accidents, injuries, and fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal goes to the floor
the brake fluid level is low
the brake line is leaking
the vehicle's braking system is soft or spongy.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty ABS sensor can cause the anti-lock braking system to malfunction, leading to unintended brake activation, loss of control, and potential accidents.
symptoms: The vehicle's brakes are applied unexpectedly
the BAS/ESP warning lights come on
the vehicle pitches or skids to one side
requiring the driver to counter-steer to maintain control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unintended activation of the brakes can cause the vehicle to jerk or swerve, potentially leading to loss of control, accidents, or near-miss situations, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The vehicle jerks or swerves to one side
the brakes are applied unexpectedly
the vehicle pulls to one side while driving
the Electronic Stability Control (ESP) system malfunctions.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake system can cause the vehicle to lose braking ability, leading to increased stopping distances, accidents, or near-miss situations.
symptoms: The brakes are soft or spongy
the brakes are uneven or pull to one side
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual
the brakes fail to engage properly.
